sentence.Network_en: Going to the theatre is our only extravagance.
sentence.Network_cn: 去剧院看戏是我们唯一的奢侈享受。

sentence.Network_en: He's always railing against his wife about her extravagance.
sentence.Network_cn: 他总是责怪妻子奢侈浪费.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French, from medieval Latin extravagant- 'diverging greatly', from the verb extravagari (see extravagant)

entry.def: Extravagance is the spending of more money than is reasonable or than you can afford.

example.tran: 严重的管理不善和资金浪费

example.ex: When the company went under, tales of his extravagance surged through the industry.
example.tran: 公司破产后，有关他铺张浪费的种种传闻传遍了整个行业。

entry.def: An extravagance is something that you spend money on but cannot really afford.

example.tran: 她唯一的奢侈品就是马。

example.ex: Why waste money on such extravagances?
example.tran: 为什么把钱浪费在这些奢侈品上呢？

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of exceeding the appropriate limits of decorum or probability or truth;

sentences.sentence: "we were surprised by the extravagance of his description"

auth_sentence.content: Fifty-five chefs prepare a seven-course menu of jaw-dropping extravagance.
auth_sentence.res_content: Fifty-five chefs prepare a seven-course menu of jaw-dropping extravagance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Fifty-five chefs prepare a seven-course menu of jaw-dropping extravagance.

auth_sentence.content: That was wanton extravagance...I'm surprised at you.
auth_sentence.res_content: That was wanton extravagance...I'm surprised at you.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: That was wanton extravagance...I'm surprised at you.

auth_sentence.content: For all his visual extravagance, he remains surprisingly unaffected.
auth_sentence.res_content: For all his visual extravagance, he remains surprisingly unaffected.

Sentence.sentence: Extravagance (奢侈) is out Business folk are bending over backwards to avoid seeming extravagant.

sentences.en: His extravagance explains why he is always in debt.
sentences.cn: 他挥霍无度, 难怪总是欠债。

sentences.en: I do not regard books as extravagances.
